response_text:
<![CDATA[CBC | Business News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/business/?cmp=rss en-ca Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA['Slippery slope': Opposition mounts to Canadian media's plan to block piracy websites]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/fairplay-piracy-website-blocking-crtc-1.4539566?cmp=rss 1.4539566 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Sophia Harris News/Business

Opposition is mounting to a coalition’s plan to block Canadians from accessing piracy websites. Many Canadians fear that the plan — backed by media companies such as Bell, Rogers and CBC — could lead to rampant internet censorship

]]> <![CDATA[Landline phone scam and luxury car purchases: CBC's Marketplace consumer cheat sheet]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/marketplace-cheat-sheet-phone-scam-luxury-cars-1.4538190?cmp=rss 1.4538190 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST CBC News News/Business

Miss something this week? Don't panic. CBC's Marketplace rounds up the consumer and health news you need.

]]> <![CDATA[Canadians take more money out of retirement savings to pay for expenses: survey]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/rrsp-retirement-savings-1.4538878?cmp=rss 1.4538878 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Rajeshni Naidu-Ghelani News/Business

Canadians are withdrawing more money from their retirement savings to pay for short-term expenses despite the tax consequences, according to a new bank survey.

]]> <![CDATA[Canada won't be 'impulsive' responding to U.S. tax cuts, Morneau says]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/morneau-economists-budget-1.4539429?cmp=rss 1.4539429 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:04:23 EST The Canadian Press News/Business

The Liberal government will not 'act in an impulsive way' in response to U.S. corporate tax cuts that economists say pose a threat to Canada's competitiveness, the federal finance minister said after a pre-budget meeting Friday.

]]> <![CDATA[PepsiCo shuts down Alberta Spitz sunflower seed factory]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/spitz-factory-alberta-1.4540237?cmp=rss 1.4540237 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 22:12:24 EST Sarah Rieger News/Canada/Calgary

Thirty years after Spitz sunflower seeds first sprouted in Alberta, the last factory in the province is set to shut down.

]]> <![CDATA[Canadian manufacturing rebounds in fourth-quarter despite soft December]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/manufacturing-december-statistics-canada-1.4538583?cmp=rss 1.4538583 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 11:19:55 EST CBC News News/Business

Statistics Canada says overall manufacturing sales for the October-December period rose by about 2.8 per cent to $164.8 billion, although the last month of year saw weaker activity.

]]> <![CDATA[Air Canada adding more planes to Rouge for use on domestic routes]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/air-canada-earnings-1.4538499?cmp=rss 1.4538499 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 08:21:36 EST The Canadian Press News/Business

Air Canada is looking to cut operating costs and defend against competition from upstart low-cost competitors by adding more planes to its Rouge fleet and flying them on regional routes within Canada.

]]> <![CDATA[Pot Pharm: Booming Canada weed sector plots next-wave medicines]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canopy-growth-1.4538913?cmp=rss 1.4538913 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 13:01:49 EST Reuters News/Business

Canopy Growth Corp., among the worlds' largest medical marijuana producers, now wants to take on the pharmaceutical giants as one of its ventures builds a portfolio of patented and federally approved cannabinoid-based medicines.

]]> <![CDATA[82-year-old great-grandmother takes on BMO for suspect life insurance advice]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/ella-beck-bmo-life-insurance-1.4532351?cmp=rss 1.4532351 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Sophia Harris News/Business

An 82-year-old great-grandmother is upset the Bank of Montreal didn't lay out all options for cancelling her life insurance. Only following a CBC News investigation did Ella Beck discover she could cancel her plan and get money back.

]]> <![CDATA[More Ram trucks recalled to fix problem with gear shifters]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/ram-truck-recall-gear-shifters-1.4538538?cmp=rss 1.4538538 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 08:57:10 EST The Associated Press News/Business

Fiat Chrysler is recalling about 229,000 Ram trucks, mostly in North America, because they can be shifted out of park without a key in the ignition or a foot on the brake.

]]> <![CDATA[Grain, oil shipments sit idle on Prairies as railways struggle to meet demand]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/railcars-shortage-alberta-1.4538115?cmp=rss 1.4538115 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 21:25:07 EST Sarah Rieger News/Canada/Calgary

A shortfall of railcars and crews has left shipments of grain and oil marooned on the Canadian Prairies — with reports that thousands of orders for cars have been cancelled by Canadian National Railway Co.

]]> <![CDATA[Fight over bankrupt oil company lands at Supreme Court]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/redwater-orphan-wells-supreme-court-1.4533626?cmp=rss 1.4533626 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 16:06:17 EST Tony Seskus News/Business

A legal battle over whether creditors take priority over the cleanup of old oil wells has landed at the Supreme Court of Canada — with seven justices now tasked with a decision that could have implications for industry and the environment across the country.

]]> <![CDATA[Higher interest rates won't 'break consumers' backs,' says CIBC]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/interest-rates-debt-consumers-1.4536744?cmp=rss 1.4536744 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 13:52:26 EST Rajeshni Naidu-Ghelani News/Business

Economists have long been warning about how higher interest rates will impact Canadians, who have elevated levels of debt, but a new report from CIBC says most consumers are in good shape and can handle the challenge.

]]> <![CDATA[Senate deal on cannabis bill timeline means no sales before August]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/senate-vote-pot-bill-1.4537624?cmp=rss 1.4537624 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 16:11:24 EST John Paul Tasker News/Politics

Leaders in the Senate have reached a deal on a timeline for the legalization of cannabis — a schedule that pushes the start of retail sales past July 1, the date that had been floated in the past as the government's target.

]]> <![CDATA[NEB clears Trans Mountain to begin pipeline tunnel work at Burnaby Mountain]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/neb-clears-trans-mountain-to-begin-pipeline-tunnel-work-at-burnaby-mountain-1.4537682?cmp=rss 1.4537682 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:08:56 EST CBC News News/Canada/British Columbia

The National Energy Board says work can begin on construction of the Trans Mountain pipeline's tunnel entrance at Burnaby Mountain — as long as the company has permits from three levels of government.

]]> <![CDATA[Canadian home sales, listings slump in January with arrival of new mortgage rules]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/crea-home-sales-1.4536604?cmp=rss 1.4536604 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 10:21:16 EST CBC News News/Business

Canadian home sales dropped sharply in January to their lowest monthly level in three years amid a retreat in listings as new mortgage rules came into place, according to a new report from a national real estate group.

]]> <![CDATA[Renegotiation, not cancellation: Trump team drops hints NAFTA end not imminent]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trump-nafta-renegotiation-cancellation-1.4536871?cmp=rss 1.4536871 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:22:34 EST Alexander Panetta News/Politics

Members of the Trump administration have dropped several hints in recent days that withdrawing from NAFTA is not in their current plans — and latest such example came Thursday.

]]> <![CDATA[Canada set to open free trade talks with South American bloc]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/canada-mercosur-free-trade-talks-1.4537338?cmp=rss 1.4537338 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:00:00 EST Evan Dyer News/Politics

Barring last-minute obstacles, Canadian negotiators plan to meet their Mercosur counterparts for talks in Asuncion, Paraguay, one day after trade minister Francois-Philippe Champagne signs the CPTPP in Santiago de Chile.

]]> <![CDATA[Sears and ex-workers deliberate on appointing trustee to review payments]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/sears-trustee-former-workers-1.4537345?cmp=rss 1.4537345 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 14:37:45 EST The Canadian Press News/Business

Lawyers representing former Sears Canada workers and their ex-employer are trying to reach an agreement on whether a trustee should be appointed to review $3 billion paid to shareholders.

]]> <![CDATA[Shaw says quarter of its workforce taking voluntary buyouts]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/shaw-jobs-buyouts-packages-calgary-1.4536615?cmp=rss 1.4536615 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 10:26:55 EST The Canadian Press News/Canada/Calgary

The departure of one-quarter of Shaw Communications Inc.'s workforce will be manageable — and mitigated by a technology-driven push toward customer self-service — even though the 3,300 who elected to take a voluntary severance package was five times more than its original estimate, its president says.

]]>
